ReportSection.title: Program Details
ReportSection.Static:
Seniors' Community Connectors-Social Prescribing

A seniors' community connector can connect you with services in your community that support health and social well-being. This pathway and program is called Social Prescribing. It is a province-wide program funded by the British Columbia Ministry of Health and operated in local community organizations throughout the province.

A seniors' community connector can help you find: 
  • Financial support
  • Transportation support
  • Mental health and substance use services
  • Physical and social activity
  • Housing support
  • Social activities and programs
  • Physical activity and exercise programs
  • Meal delivery and nutrition programs
  • Family and caregivers' support

Your local seniors' community connector will meet with you and help develop a personalized wellness plan. They can connect you with community resources that suit your needs and work with your primary care provider for additional support in your healthy aging journey.

There are three ways to find your local seniors' community connector:
  1. Call or text 2-1-1 to reach a BC211 navigator and ask about the "social prescribing program", and other resources you might be interested in exploring.
  2. Talk with your primary care provider about connecting with a seniors' community connector or social prescribing program.
  3. Visit Pathwaysbc.ca, find your community, and type "social prescribing" in the search box to find information and contact information for your local seniors' community connector.
